head.title: Police Union Begins Formal Talks With City

hedline.hl1: Police Union Begins Formal Talks With City

block.p: The Patrolmen's Benevolent Association, whose contract expires July 31, began formal talks with the city's Office of Collective Bargaining yesterday, the union said.

The union has complained bitterly about Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani's failure to give officers a raise despite the record reductions in crime in recent years, which union leaders said were won by police officers and were responsible for the city's financial resurgence.
